definition: to keep listeners in suspense (in storytelling)/to keep people on tenterhooks
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Keeping the audience guessing is a common technique in storytelling, the term for it is Liukouzi.
sentences.chinese: 卖关子是评书中常用的手段技巧，术语称留扣子。

sentences.english: Hey, tell us the ending of the story quickly. Don't keep us guessing.
sentences.chinese: 快告诉我们故事的结局吧，别卖关子了。

definition: climax (in a story)
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
to talk in riddles
(coll.) to keep sb in suspense/to tantalize/to keep on tenterhooks
to play dumb/to slack off (idiom)
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
to diverge/to branch off the road/to change (the subject)
not to mince words/not to beat about the bush
pinyin: da3 kai1 tian1 chuang1 shuo1 liang4 hua4

definition: to act stupid/to play dumb/to pretend to not know
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
to make a long story short (idiom)
to make a wild guess/blind guess
